sen.j: 順下（じゅんか）は、日本泳法の飛込み術である。
sen.e: Junka is a diving method of Japanese Martial Arts Swimming.
Junka is a diving method of Japanese martial arts swimming.
sen.cmt: Japanese martial arts swimming 小文字としました。
sen.e: Junka is a diving method of Japanese martial arts swimming.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.e: Summary
Summary
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: Summary
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 高いところから片足で踏み切り、飛び込む際に、走るときのように両足を前後に開く。
sen.e: It takes off with one leg from a height and opens both legs like a running stride at the point of diving.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: A diver takes off with one leg from a height and opens both legs like a running stride at the point of diving.
sen.cmt: a diver を主語にしました。
sen.e: A diver takes off with one leg from a height and opens both legs like a running stride at the point of diving.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 入水すると同時に両足を強く閉じ両手で水を下に押し、頭部が水中に没しないようにする。
sen.e: Immediately after hitting the water, strongly close both legs and pushes water with both hands, to avoid head dipping into water.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Immediately after hitting the water, he strongly closes both legs and pushes the water down with both hands, to avoid the head sinking under water.
sen.cmt: 一部表現を変更しました。
sen.e: Immediately after hitting the water, he strongly closes both legs and pushes the water down with both hands, to avoid the head sinking under water.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: これは甲冑をつけたままで飛び込んでも、常に敵を注視することができるようにという工夫であるという。
sen.e: This is in order to gaze steadily at enemy even when a person dives wearing Kacchu (armor and helmet).
This is said to be a measure to be able to gaze steadily at the enemy even when a person dives wearing Kacchu (armor and helmet).
sen.cmt: 一部表現を変更しました。
sen.e: This is said to be a measure to be able to gaze steadily at the enemy even when a person dives wearing Kacchu (armor and helmet).
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 向井流の特技であるともいわれる。
sen.e: It is said to be the specialty of Mukai-ryu School of Japanese Martial Arts Swimming.
It is also said to be the specialty of Mukai school.
sen.cmt: Mukai school としました。
sen.e: It is also said to be the specialty of Mukai school.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 水府流太田派でも採用されている。
sen.e: It is also adopted in Ota school of the Suifu-ryu (Suijutsu style developed for swimming and combat in fast steams).
It is also adopted in Ota group of the Suifu school (a style developed for swimming and combat in fast steams).
sen.cmt: 水府流太田派→Ota group of the Suifu school としました（定訳不明です）。
sen.e: It is also adopted in Ota group of the Suifu school (a style developed for swimming and combat in fast steams).
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 観海流では「陣笠飛」という。
sen.e: It is called 'jingasa tobi' in Kankai-ryu school of the Japanese martial arts swimming.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: It is called 'jingasa tobi' (literally, "soldier cap jumping") in Kankai school.
sen.cmt: 陣笠飛 補足を追加しました（定訳不明です）。
sen.e: It is called 'jingasa tobi' (literally, "soldier cap jumping") in Kankai school.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 陣笠をかぶったまま飛び込む際に用いられることからの称であるという。
sen.e: It is named as the method is used wearing jingasa (a soldier's cap).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: It is reportedly named as this method is used when wearing jingasa (a soldier's cap).
sen.cmt: 一部表現を変更しました。
sen.e: It is reportedly named as this method is used when wearing jingasa (a soldier's cap).
sen.cmt: 修正なし
